description.narrative: Intermediate Results (IR) 2.2 Early Childhood Development Increased Early Child Development (ECD) attendance in community based Early Child Development (ECD) centres meeting minimum standards for boys and girls aged 3-5 who are from priority marginalized communities increases from 31,300 to 145,000 through UNICEF support, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Early Learning, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Immunization, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Programme Component Results (PCR) 2 Keep Children LearningImproved education quality and learning outcomes using an equitable and inclusive approach with a focus on girls' education

mailing-address.narrative: Plot 9 George Street PO Box 7047 Kampala

sector.narrative: Capacity development of ECD frontline workers
Provision of (formal and non-formal) early-learning / pre-primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of early learning / pre-primary education teacher training
Provision of multiple-levels (or alternative pathways of education) teacher training
System strengthening - early learning / pre-primary policy, leadership, and budget
System strengthening - early learning / pre-primary standards and governance
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

title.narrative: Uganda United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Description of UNICEF programming approach framework at the country level with Common Country Assessments (CCAs) providing the equivalence of pre project appraisals
Interagency Humanitarian Response Assessments and Plans
UN Sustainable Development Group Database of Common Country Analyses
UNINFO Document Database to search for Common Country Analysis and Cooperation Framework
UNICEF Uganda Humanitarian Action for Children Appeal (HAC)
UNICEF Policy on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF Procedure on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF procedure for programme implementation partnerships
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Uganda 2021 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: IR 2.2 Early Childhood Development Increased ECD attendance in community based ECD centres meeting minimum standards forboys and girls aged 3-5 who are from priority marginalized communities increases from 31,300 to 145,000 through UNICEF support
Number of parish chiefs collecting ECD data in target districts

baseline.value: 0 Parish chiefs in 15 districts collecting ECD data

target.value: 2015:2900 parish chiefs in 28 districts collecting ECD data

actual.value: 2015:357 parish chiefs are collecting and reporting on ECD

title.narrative: Number of ECD centres with trained caregivers and CMCs in target districts

actual.value: 2015:919 centres have trained and certified early childhood development personnel

title.narrative: Number of ECD centres certified by MoES in target districts

target.value: 2015:2900 community based centres registered by MoES

actual.value: 2015:953 ECD centers to obtain government licenses to operate
